summary: Lynyrd Skynyrd is an American rock band from Florida, formed in 1964. They were one of the most popular Southern rock bands in the 1970s, known for songs like "Sweet Home Alabama." The original lineup included Ronnie Van Zant, Gary Rossington, and Allen Collins. After a plane crash in 1977 killed three members, the band reformed in 1987 with Johnny Van Zant. They continued to tour and record until 2022, when they announced their farewell tour. Lynyrd Skynyrd was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2006 and has sold over 28 million records in the U.S.
title: Lynyrd Skynyrd
